prompt.p: A 22-year-old female student presents to her general practitioner with a painful midline neck swelling and fever. She also complains of diarrhoea and fatigue. The week previously she had coryzal symptoms.

modalFeedback.p: Option A is Correct. De Quervain's thyroiditis can occur following an upper respiratory tract infection. The patient may be hyper or hypothyroid before returning to euthyroid.
Option B is Incorrect. Amiodarone or interferon can cause thyroiditis. This patient is unlikely to be on these medications.
Option C is Incorrect. Hashimoto's thyroiditis is a painless goitre resulting from an autoimmune process.
Option D is Incorrect. Ord's thyroiditis is an autoimmune condition that causes hypothyroidism. There is reduction in gland volume.
Option E is Incorrect. Riedel's thyroiditis is a painless goitre resulting from fibrosis of this and other structures (salivary gland, mediastinal or retroperitoneal fibrosis).
